Hi Javier,

Can you please add some details about how to reproduce this problem, or the 
conditions under which you see it happening?

Thanks

Hi Joe:

I which i could give you more details. This basically occurred during 
deployment to a Windows Machine as you can see in the StackTrace. That is all i 
can supply other than the thought that there could have been a temporary 
network hickup. I was running test's fine on this machine and after this 
occured I was able to continue running more test. I was using Hyades 3.0.2 with 
S.Schneiders patch that clears the session state. If this was due to a 
temporary network problem i wonder if the code should be more resilient as in 
retry a number of times after a preset amount of time. I will continue to 
monitor and supply you with more info if I can.

Created an attachment (id=18941)
With DEBUG flag on RAC

DEBUG flag set on RAC serviceconfig.xml while still experiencing socket write
error.

Per Test call on 4/25/2005 we need to determine if this exception still 
persists after the file transfer service changes have been made (faster, 
smarter, better deployment, etc).

There was a three second socket timeout set on the server-side in the file 
transfer service -- if any network problems caused response to be more than 3 
seconds, it would abort and there was no code to retry, etc.

The new file transfer service will not have this problem, it does not rely on 
socket timeouts to indicate completion of tasks.
